result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D. Kuemmeth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: statement from Atty Jerod Barkley dated 05/26/16 in re:  court appointed legal services request for payment /s/ TTF 05/25/16

Defendant Steven D. Kuemmeth in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-184, 15CM-416 and 15CT-287.

11:33 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

This matter is set for a plea.
There is a plea agreement.

15CT-287: Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed.
Defense is free to argue.
15CM-416: Dismissed and read in
16CM-184: Dismissed and read in

Atty Barkley concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 15CT-287: Count 1: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.

Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Defendant acknowledges prior convictions of OWI.
Defendant agrees that this conviction will be his fourth OWI.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CT-287: Count 1: 346.63(1)(a)  OWI 4th
15CT-287: Count 2: Dismissed
15CM-416: Dismissed and Read In
16CM-184: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends straight jail sentence.
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends post trial supervision program.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court addresses the parties, reviews the facts of the case, reviews pretrial supervision program report.

BY THE COURT:
15CT-287:
Count 1:
Jail seentence of 220 Days, Stayed
Post Trial Supervision Program for a period of 1 Year
Conditions:
Jail sentence of 150 Days
First 29 days in jail, remaining may be on home detention
1 day jail credit
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Huber granted for purposes of going to work and any AODA treatment
Fine and costs totaling $4,026
Blood draw fee of $26.45
60 days to pay or set up payment plan
Drivers License Revoked 36 Months retroactive to the first day of any administrative suspension
IID 36 Months
DOT Assessment - BAC: .302
Provide a DNA Sample

Bonds posted in 15CM-416 and 15CT-287 are to be applied to fine/costs in 15CT-287.
Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Steven D. Kuemmeth in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CM416, 15CT287, 16CM184

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

2:07 p.m.  Court takes a brief recess so that Atty Barkley can go over the plea/questionnaire form with his client. 
2:21 p.m.  Court is back in session. 
Atty Barkley makes statements to the Court.  Would like time to clarify information with the day report center. 
Court questions Atty Barkley. 
Atty Barkley indicates they are not prepared to proceed with the plea hearing today in 15CM416 & 15CT287. 

Court proceeds to the initial appearance on 16CM184.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

State recommends a signature bond with conditions as stated.
BY THE COURT:  16CM184 - $1,000 signature bond: Comply with all conditions set forth in all other bonds including the requirements for day reporting.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 12, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: and Order Granted /s/TTF 11-2-15 Atty Barkley $50/pay period - (wage assign set up in 15CT287)
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
for Attorney fees in 15CT287 & 15CM416 (receipt to 15CT287).
$50 per pay check and letter to employer

Defendant Steven D. Kuemmeth in court.  No one needed to appear for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-416 and 15CT-287.

10:54 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for an indigency hearing at this time.

10:55 AM Steven Kuemmeth is called and sworn in.
Examination by the Court.

Court finds Defendant is partially indigent. Court can appoint a lawyer if Defendant is willing to pay.

BY THE COURT:
Defendant is to sign a wage assignment, $50 out of each check, for attorney fees. (for both 15CM-416 and 15CT-287)
Court will appoint a lawyer.

Defendant is on the calendar today for a pretrial, for 10:00 am. 
Case will be continued to allow lawyer to meet with Defendant and to start working on the case.
Defendant works 6 pm to 6 am.

Court advises Defendant to contact Judicial Assistant tomorrow to find out who the attorney is.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Steven D. Kuemmeth in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CT-287 and 15CM-416.

10:03 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Defendant has received a copy of the complaint.

Address is verified. Date of birth is verified.

Defendant has looked at the complaint.  
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.

Defendant waives reading of complaints.

Court finds probable cause.

Court informs Defendant of right to counsel/public defender's office.

Defendant stands mute.
Court enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.

Bond has been set in the riverside hearing, bond is to continue on each case.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with conditions on 15PT1788(15GF315). 
Court allows 48 hours for defendant to pay the cash bond of $500.
Court orders defendant may be released on $500 signature bond.
Defendant to comply with the pre trial supervision program.

Conditions of bond on 15PT1788 (15GF315)
Can be released upon posting $500 with the remainder due by November 1, 2015. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Comply with conditions on 15PT1788(15GF315). 
Court allows 48 hours for defendant to pay the cash bond of $500.
Court orders defendant may be released on $500 signature bond.
Defendant to comply with the pre trial supervision program.

Conditions of bond on 15PT1788 (15GF315)
Can be released upon posting $500 with the remainder due by November 1, 2015. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor.
Court questions Defendant.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: October 12, 2015 at 9 a.m.  in Branch 2
